chunks.original_latin:
HAYMO HALBERSTATISCHEN EPISCOPUS
IN NAHUM PROPHETAM.
chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
<speak>
    On the Prophet Nahum<break time="500ms"/>
by Haymo of Halberstadt
<break time="1s"/>
</speak>

Nahum the prophet, like Jonah, foretold the destruction of the great city Nineveh. True to his name, which means "comforter," he brings comfort to the captives of the ten tribes taken to Nineveh by the Assyrians during the reign of King Hezekiah in Judah.

It was a great comfort to those already serving the Assyrians and to those besieged in Judah under Hezekiah, to hear that their Assyrian enemies would be captured by the Chaldeans.
chunks.original_latin:
Nahum propheta, sicut et Jonas, interitum Ninivae
civitatis magnae vaticinatus est, et secundum suum
vocabulum, qui Nahum consolator interpretatur,
consolatur captivitatem decem tribuum, quas jam
transtulerant Assyrii in Niniven, regnante in Judaea
Ezechia rege. Non enim erat parva consolatio tam
his qui jam Assyriis serviebant, quam illis qui in
Judaea sub Ezechia obsidebantur, ut audirent Assyrios
inimicos suos a Chaldaeis capiendos.
